title: Import Profile Documentation
description: Import profiles save column mapping configurations for reuse across multiple imports

columnMappings.description: Maps SwimLanes fields to source CSV columns

typeMapping.description: Maps source type values to SwimLanes types

typeInference.description: Rules for inferring type when not provided

fields.fallback: String - Default type if inference fails

dateFormat.description: Expected date format: 'auto', 'iso8601', 'us', or custom format

fields.fallback: Default lane if source is empty

options.uuid: Generate new UUIDs for all items

customFields.description: Additional columns to import as metadata

skipEmptyRows.description: Skip rows with all empty values

trimWhitespace.description: Trim leading/trailing whitespace from all values

usage.create: Create new profile during import by selecting 'Save as profile' after column mapping
usage.load: Load saved profile from Import Profiles menu
usage.edit: Modify existing profile via Settings > Import Profiles
usage.delete: Remove unused profiles via Settings > Import Profiles

bestPractices: Create separate profiles for each data source (MS Project, Jira, etc.)
Use descriptive profile names that indicate the source and format
Test profiles with dry-run imports before committing data
Document special handling in the 'notes' field
Update profiles when source formats change
Share profiles across team members for consistency

examples.jira-standard.json: Jira issue export with all fields
